perturbation.original_text: Licensee shall develop the following Wireless Product in conjunction with “In Her Shoes”: one (1) 2-D casual-style puzzle game. (“IN HER SHOES Wireless Product”)
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee shall endeavor to develop a Wireless Product in conjunction with “In Her Shoes”: one or more 2-D puzzle games. (“IN HER SHOES Wireless Product”)
perturbation.explanation: Original text clearly states the licensee *shall* develop 'one' 2D puzzle game. The modified text states the licensee *shall endeavor* to develop 'one or more' 2D puzzle games. This creates ambiguity about the mandatory nature of the development, and the exact number of games to be delivered, potentially altering the contractual obligations.

perturbation.original_text: (i) “ICE AGE 2” WIRELESS PRODUCTS: Licensee shall develop and distribute the following Wireless Products in connection with the property “ICE AGE 2”: (i) 1 Java Game; (ii) 1 Java Application (‘Screensaver’) where feasible; (iii) up to 5 MMS; (iv) up to 10 Wallpapers; (v) and up to 5 Voicetones (“ICE AGE 2 Wireless Products”) in each of the following five (5) languages: English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, with Portuguese, Greek, Dutch and Swedish to be made available where practicable. Licensee shall have the non-exclusive right and license to develop and distribute ICE AGE 2 Wireless Products during the Term of the Agreement for all Wireless Products set forth in this Paragraph 2(c) except the Game, for which Licensee shall have the exclusive right and license to develop and distribute until December 31, 2006.
perturbation.changed_text: (i) “ICE AGE 2” WIRELESS PRODUCTS: Licensee shall consider developing and distributing the following Wireless Products in connection with the property “ICE AGE 2”: (i) Possibly a Java Game; (ii) A Java Application (‘Screensaver’) if easily achieved; (iii) Potentially up to 5 MMS; (iv) Maybe up to 10 Wallpapers; (v) And perhaps up to 5 Voicetones (“ICE AGE 2 Wireless Products”) in some of the following five (5) languages: English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, with Portuguese, Greek, Dutch and Swedish to be considered. Licensee shall have the non-exclusive right and license to develop and distribute ICE AGE 2 Wireless Products during the Term of the Agreement for all Wireless Products set forth in this Paragraph 2(c) except the Game, for which Licensee shall have the exclusive right and license to develop and distribute until December 31, 2006.
perturbation.explanation: The original text is quite specific about the products *shall* be developed and the number of items. The changes introduce uncertainty by using words like 'consider', 'possibly', 'potentially', 'maybe', and 'perhaps', which replace the firm commitment to develop specific wireless products. This creates a contradiction within the contract, particularly if other sections rely on the assumption that these products will be delivered as previously 'required'.

perturbation.original_text: Fox hereby reserves the right to distribute all Wireless Products through Fox’s direct-to-consumer distribution channels, for which Fox shall retain a Distribution Fee as defined in Paragraph 4(a) of this Amendment.
perturbation.changed_text: Fox may consider distributing some Wireless Products through Fox’s direct-to-consumer distribution channels, and if so, Fox might retain a Distribution Fee possibly as defined in Paragraph 4(a) of this Amendment.
perturbation.explanation: The original text firmly states Fox *reserves the right* to distribute and *shall retain* a Distribution Fee. The modified text introduces uncertainty by stating that Fox 'may consider' distribution and 'might retain' a Fee, which is 'possibly' as defined. This weakens Fox's rights and introduces ambiguity. This can be problematic if other sections of the contract rely on Fox's right to distribution, or assume Fox's distribution fee to calculate payment structures.
